alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Shawano; Waupaca; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 11:38AM CDT until March 13 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...PROLONGED PERIOD OF ACCUMULATING SNOW CONTINUES... .A prolonged snow event will continue this afternoon as low pressure slowly moves southeast across Wisconsin. Light to moderate snow will continue across the region this afternoon, then come to an end from west to east Monday morning. A narrow band of heavier snow is expected to develop this afternoon, roughly along/near Highway 29. Minor blowing and drifting snow is possible this evening into Monday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 5 and 8 inches. Locally higher amounts expected. * WHERE...Calumet, Manitowoc, Winnebago, Brown, Outagamie, Shawano, and Waupaca Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Snow covered and slippery roads are expected. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Shawano; Waupaca; Winnebago
